DataElement.preferredName: Limited Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Sole Indication Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether limited chronic graft verses host disease is the sole indication.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Limited Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Single Indication
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: _Restricted or in amount, size, or extent._A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation:Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else._A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Limited Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Restricted or in amount, size, or extent._A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Concepts.definition: Restricted or in amount, size, or extent.

A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else._A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.

A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
